title: Ford expects to book Q3 impairment charges of up to $900 million on India fixed assets
text: Ford Motor Co. F, +0.88% said Tuesday it expects to book an impairment charge of $800 million to $900 million related to fixed assets in its India Automotive operations. The charge is required based on held-for-sale impairment testing conducted in connection with the pending sale of assets to a joint venture in India that Ford is creating with Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. 500520, +1.71%, the company said in a regulatory filing. The charge will not result in cash expenditures, said the filing. Ford said it still expects about $11 billion in potential EBIT (earnings before interest and taxes) charges for a global overhaul of its operations, with a negative cash effect of about $7 billion. Shares were not active premarket, but have gained 19.7% in 2019, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.50% has gained 18.7%.
